intro: Polygonum campanulatum, commonly known as the bellflower knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a slightly wavy margin. Polygonum campanulatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
